Well I don't know much about anything, but I sure liked this film. In short, it was creative, humorous, simple, and heartwarming.
I could sense that the people working behind the production really cared for their film. They may not be professionals by trade or taste (possibly possible), but they went above and beyond to make a wonderful short film.
The story is compacted in just under 8 minutes with immensely bold visuals orchestrated with a dreamlike tone

I had mixed feelings for "Les Valseuses" (1974) written and directed by Bertrand Blier when I started watching it but I ended up loving it. "Les Valseuses" was remade as the 1979's "The Love You Make" and reworked again for Ridley Scott's Brother's' new film, “A Good Year.” This is a film that has withstood the test of time.
